newsitem.title: UK: Prompt Brent slides under $22 on weaker gas oil.
newsitem.headline: Prompt Brent slides under $22 on weaker gas oil.

text.p: Weaker IPE gas oil futures on Thursday pulled prompt Brent crude futures below the psychologically important $22 a barrel level for the first time in over four months, traders said.
The dip at 1455 GMT followed a fall by the front month Feburary gas oil contract below key resistance at $195.50 a tonne.
Some traders said fresh fund selling just before Brent's dip gave impetus to its decline, which met resisance at 21.65/75 before recovering to $21.80 at 1517 GMT.

"Weve had some weakness in gas oil. But I wouldn't over analyse this and I wouldn't call it a break -- the volume is far too little," one trader said. "No one really knows what's going on other than the market looks weak."
Prompt futures have not fallen below $22 since September 23, 1996, when they traded at a low of $21.83, although the front-month touched $22 on December 11 and January 27.
February gas oil was $9.5 off at $191.50 at 1515 GMT. Traders attributed gas oil's fall to technical weakness and plays on the Feb/March gas oil spread.
"Feb's was pulled lower by spread play and once it fell through that 195.50 it pulled Brent down with it," one trader said. The Feb/March spread stood at $4.25 against $7.0 at Wednesday's close.
